transportAdvice: The Kilimanjaro region is not walkable for most tourist purposes, as key sites and the mountain entry points are spread across a wide rural area. Shared minibus taxis (dala-dalas) connect towns locally, but most visitors rely on arranged transfers or private taxis to reach trailheads and lodges.

weather.description: Warm and relatively dry, making it one of the better months for trekking on the mountain.
Dry and clear with good visibility, considered an excellent month for summit attempts.
The long rains begin to approach, with increasing cloud cover and occasional showers.
Peak of the long rainy season with heavy rainfall, muddy trails, and poor summit visibility.
Still firmly in the long rains, with persistent wet conditions making trekking challenging.
Rains ease off and conditions improve significantly, marking the start of a prime trekking window.
Dry and cool with excellent trail conditions and clear summit views, a peak trekking month.
Continued dry and clear weather with cool nights at altitude, ideal for climbing.
Warm days and dry skies make this another excellent month for summit attempts.
Short rains begin to build, with increasing afternoon clouds but generally manageable conditions.
Short rainy season brings frequent showers and reduced visibility on the upper mountain.
Rains begin to taper toward month's end, with conditions gradually improving for trekking.
